    DocSeeker.alldocs — Function.
    alldocs() -> Vector{DocObj}

    Find all docstrings in all currently loaded Modules.

    DocSeeker.baseURL — Function.
    baseURL(links::Vector{Markdown.Link}) -> String

    Find the most common host and return the first URL in links with that host.

    DocSeeker.basepath
    DocSeeker.createdocsdb — Function.
    createdocsdb()

    Asynchronously create a "database" of all local docstrings in Pkg.dir(). This is done by loading all packages and using introspection to retrieve the docstrings – the obvious limitation is that only packages that actually load without errors are considered.

    DocSeeker.dbpath
    DocSeeker.determinetype
    DocSeeker.docsdir — Function.
    docsdir(pkg) -> String

    Find the directory conataining the documenatation for package pkg. Will fall back to returning a package's README.md. Returns an empty String if no indication of documentation is found.

    DocSeeker.docsurl — Function.
    docsurl(pkg) -> String

    Return the most likely candidate for a package's online documentation or an empty string.

    DocSeeker.dynamicsearch
    DocSeeker.eval
    DocSeeker.finddocsURL — Function.
    finddocsURL(pkg) -> Vector{Markdown.Link}

    Search pkgs readme for links to documentation.

    DocSeeker.loaddocsdb — Function.
    loaddocsdb() -> Vector{DocObj}

    Retrieve the docstrings from the "database" created by createdocsdb(). Will return an empty vector if the database is locked by createdocsdb().

    DocSeeker.lockpath
    DocSeeker.modulebindings

    DocSeeker.readmepath
    DocSeeker.score — Function.
    score(needle, s::Docs.DocObj) -> Float

    Scores s against the search query needle. Returns a Float between 0 and 1.
